page.title: 17HOUSING-GRIMLEY & SINTON GRN
page.content: The buildings in Grimley village usually follow the line of the road. Most are brick built with tiled roofs. There are several old detached and semi-detached cottages built of bricks from the local disused works. Some of these cottages and a farm are owned by the Church. Five large detached and a pair of semi-detached houses and five bungalows/chalet bungalows have recently been built. (Re: Historic Houses). There are no council houses. The buildings of Sinton Green foll- ow the perimeter of the Green and the five radial roads. There are a few old detached timber-framed and semi-de- tached Victorian cottages and farm houses. There is a country house, and large modern detached houses and bun- galows. Eight pairs of semi-detached dwellings are council owned. There is a site for mobile homes.
